channel.title: aws-events on because there are just too many things to remember
channel.description: Recent content in aws-events on because there are just too many things to remember

item.title: Resources worth bookmarking and other jq lessons
item.description: It’s been a while since the last lesson. In that time, my computer died and was repaired and I’ve finally got things back together. Today we’re going to dive into more useful jq things, but also I’m going to refer to resources worth bookmarking. First up: jqterm. This is a fantastic tool to test your queries iteractively. It does almost everything you could do in a terminal on your laptop, and gives immediate visual feedback.

item.title: lessons 10 through 12
item.description: last time on jq Another way of producing a text list of running instances may be to push the fields we want though another jq function - join. Lesson 10 Using functions There are a number of useful functions in jq that will make life a little easier. Let’s explore some of them. join A function to join an array into a string. Whereas before we created a string using String iterpolation, we could simply use join.
